case_vignette: A 23-year-old man comes to the emergency department for 2 days of severe headaches. The pain is most intense on his left forehead and eye. He had similar symptoms last summer. He has been taking indomethacin every 6 hours for the last 24 hours but has not had any relief. He has smoked 1 pack of cigarettes daily for the past 5 years. He works as an accountant and describes his work as very stressful. Physical examination shows drooping of the left eyelid, tearing of the left eye, and rhinorrhea. The left pupil is 2 mm and the right pupil is 4 mm. There is localized tenderness along the right supraspinatus muscle. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having severe headaches for the past 2 days, mainly around my left forehead and eye.
Have you noticed any changes in your vision or experienced any eye pain?
Yes, my left eyelid is drooping, and my left eye has been tearing up.
Do you have any history of similar headaches or been diagnosed with any neurological conditions in the past?
I had similar symptoms last summer, but I've not been diagnosed with any neurological conditions.
Are you currently experiencing or recently experienced any stress, lack of sleep, or changes in your regular routine?
My work as an accountant is very stressful.
Have you noticed any spots or flashes of light in your vision or any numbness in your face or body?
No, I haven't noticed any spots or flashes of light in my vision, nor any numbness in my face or body.
Have you had any nausea, vomiting, or sensitivity to light or sound along with the headaches?
No, I haven't had any nausea, vomiting, or sensitivity to light or sound.
Is there any personal or family history of migraines or other types of headaches?
I haven't mentioned any personal or family history of migraines or other types of headaches.
Have you been taking any medication for the headaches, and if so, has it provided any relief?
I've been taking indomethacin every 6 hours for the last 24 hours, but it hasn't provided any relief.
Given your symptoms of severe headaches with eye tearing and eyelid drooping, and the lack of relief from indomethacin, **Final Diagnosis: Cluster Headaches.**
